title: Basel Cellars 2015 Inspired Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: A blend of Merlot and Cabernet Franc, high toned aromas of vanilla, exotic spice, raspberry and cherry are followed by light, plump fruit and barrel flavors that finish a touch bitter.

title: Bel Ormeau 2015 Boisvert  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: This is one of three cuvées from Bel Ormeau. It is full of red-berry fruits and gentle tannins. Balanced and rounded, it is already generous and certainly ripe. Drink from 2021.

title: Big Six 2015 Whiskey Bourbon Barrel Red (California)
description: This is a full-flavored, oaky wine that is lavish in its emphasis on sweet-seeming baking spices and wood smoke in both the aromas and the flavors. It feels smooth and velvety on the palate, where the spiciness reverberates with blackberry and milk chocolate for a sweet-seeming finish.

title: Bonacchi 2013  Brunello di Montalcino
description: This opens with delicate aromas of plum and underbrush that carry over to the straightforward palate alongside a touch of white pepper. Smooth tannins lend easygoing support.

title: Bonacchi 2013 Molino del Piano  (Brunello di Montalcino)
description: Subdued of aromas of dark cherry, baking spice and underbrush segue over to the lean palate together with a white-pepper note. Round, not very persistent tannins lead to a rather short finish. Drink through 2023.

title: Bostavan 2016 Dor Rara Neagra-Cabernet Sauvignon Red (Moldova)
description: Garnet in the glass, this is a blend of 51% Rara Neagra and 49% Cabernet Sauvignon. The nose offers aromas of coffee, blackberry and dried plums. On the palate it has flavors of black cherry, red raspberry and blackberry, with a touch of milk chocolate on the finish.

title: Fäsi 2015 Torrontés (Cafayate)
description: Initial aromas of rose hips, lychee, citrus and vanilla break down and turn gritty, evidence that this older Torrontés is starting to crumble. A lemony palate is surprisingly tight and focused for something from 2015, while this wine tastes of orange peel and salt prior to a briny finish.

title: Gitana 2014 Autograf Cabernet Sauvignon (Moldova)
description: This garnet colored Cabernet Sauvignon has aromas of black cherry, saddle leather and tobacco leaf, with flavors of black cherry and dried plum. The tannins are a bit grippy on the lingering finish.

title: Hawley 2016 Hopkins River Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Robust ripeness and oak rule the day in this hearty white, big on flavors of butterscotch and caramel.

title: Josh Cellars 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: A dark color and extracted flavors of grape skins and blackberries accompany a very firm texture that's laced with sandy tannins. These elements make for a bold, full-bodied and monolithic wine.

title: La Forge Estate 2016 Pinot Noir (Languedoc)
description: Scents of black plum and cherry skins open the nose of this tight, dark wine, with subtle accents of fresh mint and menthol in the background. Medium in weight, it's surprisingly tannic and gripping, with a pronounced black tea-like astringency on the close alongside flavors of black fruit and licorice.

title: Les Vignerons des Terroirs de la Noëlle 2016 L'Aubinière Sur Lie  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)
description: This is a ripe, creamy wine, full of baked apple and Bartlett-pear flavors. Its soft texture has just the right crisp acidity to keep it fresh and deliciously fruity. Drink now.
winery: Les Vignerons des Terroirs de la Noëlle

title: Marrenon 2016 Roséfine Rosé (Mediterranée)
description: Delicate berry and dusty mineral tones abound in this dry, crisply composed rosé. It's a tad muted in style but a balanced, refreshing thirst quencher.

title: Oyster Bay 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This is a straightforward and quite typical style of Kiwi Sauvignon Blanc, with tropical fruits—pineapple and guava—along with peach, lime and green bell pepper. The palate is crisp, fruity and well suited to summer sipping.

title: Piattelli 2016 Reserve Malbec-Tannat (Cafayate)
description: Heavy, roasted aromas are low on fruit scents. This blend of Malbec and Tannat is stewy and sticky in feel. Soupy berry flavors finish chewy and thick, with a cooked quality.

title: Santa Julia 2016 Magna Red (Valle de Uco)
description: Aromas of latex, Pepto-Bismol and stalky berry fruits lack clarity and cohesion. This blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec and Syrah is dense and chewy, but also heavy. Stewed black-fruit flavors lead to a thick finish with medicinal prune notes.

title: Santa Julia 2017 Reserva Chardonnay (Valle de Uco)
description: Citrusy aromas of orange peel and pulp show slight minerality. This wine feels plump, with racy acidity forming a welcome offset. Orange peel and briny melon flavors are salty on a finish with a round texture.

title: Sawtooth 2015 Trout Trilogy Carmenère
description: Not entirely settled aromas of vanilla, white pepper, green pepper and spice lead to tart, light cherry and pepper flavors. It doesn't all come together, not quite seeming to have fully ripened.

title: Seven Daughters 2016 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This is a good weekday wine that smells and tastes fresh, uncomplicated and quite fruity, feels smooth on the palate and has a clean finish.

title: Snowbirds 2016 Grüner Veltliner (Lake Chelan)
description: Light aromas of cut green apple, lentil, pear and spice are followed by mild fruit flavors on the palate. Enjoy for its easy appeal.

title: Vini 2016 Veni Vidi Vici Pinot Grigio (Danube River Plains)
description: Aromas of lemon zest and Granny Smith apple carry the nose and lead the way to a palate of lemon curd and more green apple.

title: Waterbrook 2016 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Bright aromas of candied plum, herb and baking spice are followed by plentiful ripe plum and black currant flavors.

title: Cosenza Cellars 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Black olive dominates on the nose of this lightly textured wine, which offers smoothness on the palate amid a quietly rich backdrop of black currant and chocolate.

title: Cottesbrook 2016 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This is ultraripe and aromatic in style, with tones of perfume and air freshener. Pungent flavors of flowers, limes, stone fruits and bell peppers are followed by searing acidity and a biting finish.

title: Cabana Wines 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: An earthy streak in the aroma and flavor marks this wine as a bit of an outlier while fairly generous red and black-cherry flavors give a good payoff on the palate. The wine is medium-bodied, light on tannins and smooth to sip.

title: California Roots 2016 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Semisweet and very fruity, this easy-drinking wine has floral peachy aromas and flavors and a soft texture with just enough of a citrus component to keep it lively.

title: Callaway 2014 Winemaker's Reserve Roussanne (Temecula Valley)
description: Orange blossom, wet rocks and chamomile-syrup aromas show on the nose of this reserved take on an often unctuous grape. The palate is more about texture than overt flavors, with a grippy frame slowly revealing flavors of lime cream.

title: Cholila Ranch 2016 Malbec (Patagonia)
description: Spicy plum and raspberry aromas are on the hot side. This wine feels racy but mostly standard, with a medium body. Plum and berry flavors are a touch green, and it finishes with heat, crispness and spicy red-berry notes.

title: Cleto Chiarli NV Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Vino Spumante)
description: Aromas of crushed rosemary and yellow apple follow over to the crisp palate along with a tangy note of nectarine peel. It's racy, with brisk acidity and a vivacious perlage.

title: Colter's Creek 2016 Juliaette Estate Bottled Rosé (Lewis-Clark Valley (ID))
description: A blend of Sangiovese, Cinsault and Mourvèdre, this wine is electric pink in color with an orange tinge. The aromas are not entirely cohesive, with notes of herb and cherry that lead to well styled fruit flavors.
